description.narrative:
Uppsala University is an internationally oriented research university with the task of gaining and imparting knowledge for the benefit of humanity and for a better world through education and research of the highest quality and relevance as well as well-developedcollaboration with business and society. As an integrated educational and research environment and a meeting place for knowledge, culture and critical dialogue, the university, with its disciplinary breadth, has unique opportunities to develop new areas of knowledge through cross-border collaborations.
Uppsala University's vision, goals and strategies The mission of Uppsala University is to gain and disseminate knowledge for the benefit of humankind and for a better world. The University rests on the idea and fundamentalbelief that investments in education and research contribute to a better future. The ultimate goal is for research and education tomake a difference in society in the long term. Our University will put all its breadth and combined strength into supporting sustain- able development, engaging with the wider community and promoting openness and respect Sustainable development Uppsala University aspires to a leading role in the transition to a more sustainable society. The present and future challenges facing society largely concern the need for sustainability. As a full-scale research university, Uppsala University is well equipped to contribute to sustainable development Collaboration The University operates at the heartof the society to which it belongs. Collaboration enables theacademic knowledge base to make an impact and be of use in society, while also providing new inspiration for education and research Equal opportunities Equal opportunities are a matter of rights for the individual and quality for the University. The University’s study and work environment must be characterized by openness and respect. The UNESO Chair on International Water Cooperation The university also hosts the first UNESCO Chair on International Water Cooperation. Research led by this chair at the Department of Conflict and Peace Research looks at cross-cutting issues of shared waters, regional cooperation, water security and hydro-diplomacy.

participating-org.narrative:
Uppsala University is an internationally oriented research university with the task of gaining and imparting knowledge for the benefit of humanity and for a better world through education and research of the highest quality and relevance as well as well-developedcollaboration with business and society. As an integrated educational and research environment and a meeting place for knowledge, culture and critical dialogue, the university, with its disciplinary breadth, has unique opportunities to develop new areas of knowledge through cross-border collaborations.
Uppsala University's vision, goals and strategies
The mission of Uppsala University is togain and disseminate knowledge for the benefit of humankind and for a better world. The University rests on the idea and fundamental belief that investments in education and research contribute to a better future. The ultimate goal is for research and education to make a difference in society in the long term. Our University will put all its breadth and combined strength into supporting sustain- able development, engaging with the wider community and promoting openness and respect
Sustainable development
Uppsala University aspires to a leading role in the transition to a more sustainable society. The present and future challenges facing society largely concern the need for sustainability. As a full-scale research university, Uppsala University is well equipped to contribute to sustainable development
Collaboration The University operates at the heart of the society to which it belongs. Collaboration enables the academic knowledge base to make an impact and be of use in society, while also providing new inspiration for education and research
Equal opportunities
Equal opportunities are a matter of rights for the individual and quality for the University. The University’s study and work environment must be characterized by openness and respect. The UNESO Chair on International Water Cooperation The university also hosts the first UNESCO Chair on International Water Cooperation. Research led by this chair at the Department ofConflict and Peace Research looks at cross-cutting issues of shared waters, regional cooperation, water security and hydro-diplomacy. A regional analysis of cost of non-cooperation in South Asian shared waters (GBM basins): We would like to jointly initiate this regional analysis to identify the potential costs of non-cooperation and use the study findings to further mobilize our advocacy andengagement efforts with sub-regional initiatives (like BIMSTEC, SASEC, BBIN) and national governments from the GBM basins

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
